name: Hongaek
description: The Hongaek is a large, insidious elemental with a vaporous form and the ability to become invisible. It wields tentacles that deliver painful poison attacks and can sweep through tight spaces with ease.
memorable: Its ability to become invisible and move through tight spaces makes it a master of ambushes, while its potent poison attacks can leave foes vulnerable.
goals: To infect and dominate foes with debilitating diseases while evading direct confrontation.
relations: Can be associated with other elemental creatures, especially those related to poison and disease.
environment: Commonly found in toxic swamps or areas infused with elemental energy.
strengths: High Dexterity allows it to dodge attacks and act quickly; resistance to many damage types makes it durable.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to fire damage, making it easier to harm with fire-based attacks.
attacks: The Hongaek attacks with vaporous tentacles that deal poison damage and can inflict the poisoned condition.
most_powerful_ability: The ability to cast Contagion can severely debilitate its enemies by inflicting debilitating diseases.
senses: Possesses blindsight within a 90-foot radius, allowing it to detect foes without sight.
skills: Proficient in Medicine and Perception, indicating a capability to heal and spot threats effectively.
additional_information: Immune to poison damage and a variety of conditions
Can pinpoint locations of afflicted creatures within 30 feet
Advantage on attacks against poisoned enemies with Exacerbate Affliction
Can hover, providing enhanced mobility in combat
spellcasting: Can innately cast the spell Contagion once per day, allowing it to inflict diseases on targets.
test_queries: large elemental that can fly and becomes invisible
swift vaporous creature with poison attacks
ambush creature that can move through small spaces
intangible monster that deals poison damage
elemental that excels in stealth and disease
